bility":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"from","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"ticketId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.","params":{"to":"address to be approved for the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be approved"}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address.","params":{"owner":"address to query the balance of"},"return":"uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address"},"createScope(string,address,address[],address[],bool)":{"details":"The function MUST throw if the provided name is emptyThe function MUST throw if the provided name contains uppercase lettersThe function MUST throw if the provided name is already defined","params":{"mint_admins":"Array of address allowed to mint tickets","scope_name":"Name to give to the new scope","tokenuri_provider":"Address of TokenURIProvider contract. `address(0)` is none should be used.","transfer_admins":"Array of addresses. They all become transfer admins for the scope's tickets. This                        means they can trigger any transfers. Made to be used on contracts like marketplaces.","user_exchangeable":"True if users can exchange tickets outside of the allowed transfer contracts"}},"getApproved(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given token ID"},"getMintNonce(address)":{"params":{"owner":"Address to check"}},"getScope(string)":{"params":{"scope_name":"Name of the scope to check.     "}},"getTokenID(address,uint256)":{"params":{"_mint_nonce":"Nonce of owner mintings","owner":"Address of initial token owner"}},"isAllowedMinter(uint256,address)":{"params":{"minter":"address of minter to check     ","scopeIndex":"index of scope to check"}},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.","params":{"operator":"operator address which you want to query the approval of","owner":"owner address which you want to query the approval of"},"return":"bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner"},"isScopeAdmin(string,address)":{"params":{"admin":"Address to check.     ","scope_name":"Name of the scope to check."}},"mint(address,uint256)":{"params":{"scopeIndex":"Index of desired scope","to":"Address of initial owner"}},"mint(address,uint256,string)":{"params":{"scopeIndex":"Index of desired scope","to":"Address of initial owner","tokenUri":"Token Uri to assign to new token"}},"ownerOf(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the owner of the specified token ID.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of"},"return":"address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID"},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","ticketId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"_data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the token","ticketId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.","params":{"approved":"representing the status of the approval to be set","to":"operator address to set the approval"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."},"tokenByIndex(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the token ID at a given index of all the tokens in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of tokens.","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the tokens list"},"return":"uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list"},"tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the token ID at a given index of the tokens list of the requested owner.","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested tokens list","owner":"address owning the tokens list to be accessed"},"return":"uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list owned by the requested address"},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"params":{"ticketId":"Id of Ticket     "}},"totalSupply()":{"details":"Gets the total amount of tokens stored by the contract.","return":"uint256 representing the total amount of tokens"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use `safeTransferFrom` whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","ticketId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"createScope(string,address,address[],address[],bool)":{"notice":"Creates an immutable scope. Define transfer admins that can trigger any transfers         on any user's behalf. This is meant to delegate logics like marketplaces to other         contracts. Do not use this to set wallets as admins ...         The tokenuri_provider is a contract that implement the TokenURIProvider interface.         This contract will be called to resolve tokenURIs. Set to 0x000.. to use a normal         behavior where each token should have its own tokenURI."},"getMintNonce(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the current mint nonce of an address"},"getScope(string)":{"notice":"Utility to get scope's existence and tokenURI provider."},"getTokenID(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Generates the deterministic mint ID for an owner"},"isAllowedMinter(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Utility to know if a provided address is a mint admin able to create tickets.         If `address(0)` is a mint admin, this will return true for all addresses."},"isScopeAdmin(string,address)":{"notice":"Utility to know if a provided address is a admin of provided scope name"},"mint(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Create a new ERC-721 token assigned to given address, under specified scope"},"mint(address,uint256,string)":{"notice":"Creates a new ERC-721 token assigned to given address, under specified scope. Also         assigns given token uri."},"name()":{"notice":"Utility to recover ERC-721 Metadata Name     "},"symbol()":{"notice":"Utility to recover ERC-721 Metadata Symbol     "},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"notice":"Utility to recover the tokenUri for a specific ticketId.         If a TokenUri provider is set on the scope, will call him instead."}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/mortimr/projects/repo/modules/@contracts_ticketforge/contracts/TicketForge.sol":"TicketForge"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/mortimr/projects/repo/modules/@contracts_ticketforge/contracts/ITokenUriProvider.sol":{"keccak256":"0xcc7085b1139f04ecff58f41f47106f499f9f30dc6df2a2601b1ae9f18490968f","urls":["bzz-raw://44253d7ff9f102cc0a23620f0a9909968b2e7bcda5ed18cfc62d262f86567403","dweb:/ipfs/QmSL9QLAR89GsRxToLAiHGcLMknmMqRoKXGZ5KtnhnktXP"]},"/Users/mortimr/projects/repo/modules/@contracts_ticketforge/contracts/TicketForge.sol":{"keccak256":"0x66fe672ccbd6e781395f50454b25e498c7548121117afb453cd0f77bd67f8f9a","urls":["bzz-raw://35aefbaf49b844921e9deafb28c210c4e8203a7fe855f5eaad8dac9564716f37","dweb:/ipfs/QmXfHheYX5wusLzpiWsSiT2nvTzjSo2YvuMdr8Fuy7CZVt"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/drafts/Counters.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5eb69360d3441ab2ee799bd7c007cccbffb0896f12b2dfe1456193e2aa180a11","urls":["bzz-raw://072e8b5a1b5acfc2acba9b6fb87d1dc57065aad44572617ad46b014074969eb3","dweb:/ipfs/QmVTDHUriaxBJqiWCWgWC8vYaYYfXSz883LsowzTx1DcpK"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/introspection/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0xac2eacd7e7762e275442f28f21d821544df5aae2ed7698af13be8c41b7005e2e","urls":["bzz-raw://8bdbefb642e7b08535c66bbf074e576cfef2300cdf910c1e0b211f6393833a28","dweb:/ipfs/QmQhfx2Ufr8a2gFXm3KogL66xGgAuAWMwcamkWFKGG6Vya"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x661553e43d7c4fbb2de504e5999fd5c104d367488350ed5bf023031bd1ba5ac5","urls":["bzz-raw://b40442c5b350b57b88a081a1eacd2bac962d4ecc1f029f5447a18986f08f6f14","dweb:/ipfs/QmV7wjtRf11ibUHh4g8JjuhMpy68pPhV95L2y46UBoRfsZ"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd1804d04fb39689453f673601429a99a0c68c422a981fc338773df9a59180fe9","urls":["bzz-raw://1b9307920e0378d58c6677f8952ad090a9ecb30e878835e301a0d18386a870c1","dweb:/ipfs/QmYYixTDVF4FXqFpYzEcufAwEY9BFBJ33Ew9ncsGvD7b nodes.documentation:
@notice Creates an immutable scope. Define transfer admins that can trigger any transfers
         on any user's behalf. This is meant to delegate logics like marketplaces to other
         contracts. Do not use this to set wallets as admins ...
         The tokenuri_provider is a contract that implement the TokenURIProvider interface.
         This contract will be called to resolve tokenURIs. Set to 0x000.. to use a normal
         behavior where each token should have its own tokenURI.
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name is empty
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name contains uppercase letters
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name is already defined
     *  @param scope_name Name to give to the new scope
     *  @param tokenuri_provider Address of TokenURIProvider contract. `address(0)` is none should be used.
     *  @param transfer_admins Array of addresses. They all become transfer admins for the scope's tickets. This
                        means they can trigger any transfers. Made to be used on contracts like marketplaces.
     *  @param mint_admins Array of address allowed to mint tickets
     *  @param user_exchangeable True if users can exchange tickets outside of the allowed transfer contracts
nodes.name: createScope

nodes.documentation:
@notice Creates an immutable scope. Define transfer admins that can trigger any transfers
         on any user's behalf. This is meant to delegate logics like marketplaces to other
         contracts. Do not use this to set wallets as admins ...
         The tokenuri_provider is a contract that implement the TokenURIProvider interface.
         This contract will be called to resolve tokenURIs. Set to 0x000.. to use a normal
         behavior where each token should have its own tokenURI.
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name is empty
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name contains uppercase letters
     *  @dev The function MUST throw if the provided name is already defined
     *  @param scope_name Name to give to the new scope
     *  @param tokenuri_provider Address of TokenURIProvider contract. `address(0)` is none should be used.
     *  @param transfer_admins Array of addresses. They all become transfer admins for the scope's tickets. This
                        means they can trigger any transfers. Made to be used on contracts like marketplaces.
     *  @param mint_admins Array of address allowed to mint tickets
     *  @param user_exchangeable True if users can exchange tickets outside of the allowed transfer contracts
nodes.name: createScope

approve(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.

params.to: address to be approved for the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be approved

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: address to query the balance of

balanceOf(address).return: uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address

createScope(string,address,address[],add.details: The function MUST throw if the provided name is emptyThe function MUST throw if the provided name contains uppercase lettersThe function MUST throw if the provided name is already defined

params.mint_admins: Array of address allowed to mint tickets
params.scope_name: Name to give to the new scope
params.tokenuri_provider: Address of TokenURIProvider contract. `address(0)` is none should be used.
params.transfer_admins: Array of addresses. They all become transfer admins for the scope's tickets. This                        means they can trigger any transfers. Made to be used on contracts like marketplaces.
params.user_exchangeable: True if users can exchange tickets outside of the allowed transfer contracts

getApproved(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of

getApproved(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given token ID

params.scope_name: Name of the scope to check.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.

params.operator: operator address which you want to query the approval of
params.owner: owner address which you want to query the approval of

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner

params.scope_name: Name of the scope to check.

params.tokenUri: Token Uri to assign to new token

ownerOf(uint256).details: Gets the owner of the specified token ID.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of

ownerOf(uint256).return: address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.ticketId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params._data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.ticketId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.

params.approved: representing the status of the approval to be set
params.to: operator address to set the approval

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

tokenByIndex(uint256).details: Gets the token ID at a given index of all the tokens in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of tokens.

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the tokens list

tokenByIndex(uint256).return: uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).details: Gets the token ID at a given index of the tokens list of the requested owner.

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested tokens list
params.owner: address owning the tokens list to be accessed

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).return: uint256 token ID at the given index of the tokens list owned by the requested address

totalSupply().details: Gets the total amount of tokens stored by the contract.
totalSupply().return: uint256 representing the total amount of tokens

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use `safeTransferFrom` whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.

params.ticketId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID

createScope(string,address,address[],add.notice: Creates an immutable scope. Define transfer admins that can trigger any transfers         on any user's behalf. This is meant to delegate logics like marketplaces to other         contracts. Do not use this to set wallets as admins ...         The tokenuri_provider is a contract that implement the TokenURIProvider interface.         This contract will be called to resolve tokenURIs. Set to 0x000.. to use a normal         behavior where each token should have its own tokenURI.

getMintNonce(address).notice: Retrieves the current mint nonce of an address

getScope(string).notice: Utility to get scope's existence and tokenURI provider.

getTokenID(address,uint256).notice: Generates the deterministic mint ID for an owner

isAllowedMinter(uint256,address).notice: Utility to know if a provided address is a mint admin able to create tickets.         If `address(0)` is a mint admin, this will return true for all addresses.

isScopeAdmin(string,address).notice: Utility to know if a provided address is a admin of provided scope name

mint(address,uint256).notice: Create a new ERC-721 token assigned to given address, under specified scope

mint(address,uint256,string).notice: Creates a new ERC-721 token assigned to given address, under specified scope. Also         assigns given token uri.

name().notice: Utility to recover ERC-721 Metadata Name

symbol().notice: Utility to recover ERC-721 Metadata Symbol

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Utility to recover the tokenUri for a specific ticketId.         If a TokenUri provider is set on the scope, will call him instead.
